body_text: The plucking works. It shadows the imported value, but it doesn't cause any problems. It is kind of a footgun though. Something we could do would be to change the import to import * as recipeActions from 'control_new/state/recipes/actions', and change connect to reference is as recipeActions.fetchFilteredRecipesPage. It is a bit more verbose, and we lose some static analysis, but it avoids the shadowing problem. I think shadowing is a bigger concern.
body: The plucking works. It shadows the imported value, but it doesn't cause any problems. It is kind of a footgun though. Something we could do would be to change the import to `import * as recipeActions from 'control_new/state/recipes/actions'`, and change `connect` to reference is as `recipeActions.fetchFilteredRecipesPage`. It is a bit more verbose, and we lose some static analysis, but it avoids the shadowing problem. I think shadowing is a bigger concern.
body_html: The plucking works. It shadows the imported value, but it doesn't cause any problems. It is kind of a footgun though. Something we could do would be to change the import to import * as recipeActions from 'control_new/state/recipes/actions', and change connect to reference is as recipeActions.fetchFilteredRecipesPage. It is a bit more verbose, and we lose some static analysis, but it avoids the shadowing problem. I think shadowing is a bigger concern.
